subs.text: “This is a fitting coda to the end of Chief of Staff Aviv Kochavi’s term. Under him, the IDF adopted a policy of lying to the media. Its relations with the press became so warped that it engaged in what appears to have been actual fraud during Operation Guardian of the Walls.” [link]

subs.text: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).
subs.rawText: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).

subs.text: @MisfitTorah Tanakh strongly platforms the critics of the establishment. Its only constructive utopian suggestions relate to architecture.
subs.rawText: @MisfitTorah Tanakh strongly platforms the critics of the establishment. Its only constructive utopian suggestions relate to architecture.

subs.text: @MisfitTorah Implicitly, it opposes systems of government that throw critics out windows.
subs.rawText: @MisfitTorah Implicitly, it opposes systems of government that throw critics out windows.

subs.text: @MisfitTorah While the closest I came to reading Milton was hearing R Aharon z”l give a shiur once, I suspect the first strong defense of press freedom makes explicit reference to Tanakh. So there’s that.
subs.rawText: @MisfitTorah While the closest I came to reading Milton was hearing R Aharon z”l give a shiur once, I suspect the first strong defense of press freedom makes explicit reference to Tanakh. So there’s that.

subs.text: @MisfitTorah The fact that Shmuel thinks the monarchy is a bad idea but implements it any way speaks to a lack of concern about the fine points of the constitution.
subs.rawText: @MisfitTorah The fact that Shmuel thinks the monarchy is a bad idea but implements it any way speaks to a lack of concern about the fine points of the constitution.
